chapter.title: Managing multiple hosts at the same time
chapter.para: Cockpit allows you to access multiple hosts in a single session, by establishing SSH connections to other hosts. This is quite similar to logging into these other hosts using the "ssh" command on the command line, with one very important difference:

Code from the local host and all the remote hosts run at the same time, in the same browser context. They are not sufficiently isolated from each other in the browser. All code effectively has the same privileges as the primary session on the local host.
Thus, you should only only connect to remote hosts that you trust. You must be sure that none of the hosts that you connect to will cause Cockpit to load malicious JavaScript code into your browser.

Going forward, Cockpit will try to provide sufficient isolation to make it safe to manage multiple hosts in a single Cockpit session. But until we get there, Cockpit will at least warn you before connecting to more than one host. It is also possible to disable multiple hosts entirely, and some operating systems do this already by default.
